intro: Epidryos guayanensis, commonly known as the Guayana epidryos, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are broad and palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Epidryos guayanensis is often found growing in moist, shaded areas along riverbanks and in dense forest understories.
